result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury
Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dale Hartley-Leon Dotson

records.addlTxt: same as original complaint. Counts 1-3. arc
Signed by DE and Atty. kma

3:36 PM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: S. Bridges. Defendant Dale Hartley-Leon Dotson in court. Attorney Joel David Schlitz in court for Dale Hartley-Leon Dotson. Attorney Brian Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for victim. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waives preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause and binds DE over for trial. Bond continues in form and amount. Court confirms DE's address and phone number. Adjourned 3:41 PM. srb
Arraignment scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
for Alleged Victim. Filed by Atty. Schutte. kma

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Torri P.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:59 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Tyler Kongslien for Joel David Schlitz in court for Dale Hartley-Leon Dotson, Defendant Dale Hartley-Leon Dotson in court. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. Atty. Kongslien states that a substitution request was filed. Court sets bond. Prelim time limits waived. Adjourned: 2:04 PM. kma
